isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AUTOMATIC POSITIVE LOCKING TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS (NOSPIN/DETROIT LOCKER) - MAINTENANCE - RETAINING BOLT

svcproc.title: RETAINING BOLT
svcproc.para: A retaining bolt and washers are useful to keep the NoSPIN differential assembly intact when removing it from the differential case and when re-installing it in the axle housing.

warning.para: Failure to use a retaining bolt or some other restraining means when separating the differential case halves can cause injury in that NoSPIN differentials have compressed springs.

svcproc.para: The bolt, washers and wing nut used to retain the NoSPIN differential assembly when it was shipped from the factory, as illustrated in Figure 1, are best for this purpose. You will note that the retaining washers must be small enough to pass through the case ends (Dimension "A," Figure 1), yet large enough to restrain the two side gears (Dimension "B," Figure 1) and the balance of the NoSPIN differential assembly when all parts are assembled and the springs are compressed.
